wesm commented on issue #4355: ARROW-3372: [C++] Add SlicedBuffer class, move parent_ member out of Buffer
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4355#issuecomment-494528054
 
 
   I fixed up arrow_cuda. The issue of slicing a CudaBuffer while retaining its special properties is a bit particular to CudaBuffer.
   
   I think it's probably a good idea to also add a `Slice` virtual method that can be overridden by `CudaBuffer` so that you can do `static_pointer_cast<CudaBuffer>(cu_buf->Slice(...))`. I don't think that we should burden some of our core IPC paths with these issues and using "simple" buffer slicing as we have not. As long as we have (or add):
   
   * A method to determine what kind of underlying memory a Buffer references
   * Functions to cast/wrap a Buffer in the appropriate device-specific buffer (like `CudaBuffer::FromBuffer`)
   
   then we are OK

fields.description:
The purpose of this class will be to forward certain function calls to the parent buffer, like a request for the device (CPU, GPU, etc.).

As a result of this, we can remove the {{parent_}} member from {{Buffer}} as that member is only there to support slices.

comments.body: I'm not sure that's really useful. I think ARROW-3221 and ARROW-2446 would favorably rationalize the situation.
We can consider various solutions, and also evaluate the impact on performance in hot paths where we slice many buffers
